VirtualDevicecreate.Description: Create new device controller from available templates. It returns the resourceID on which new device controller is created.

VirtualDeviceslist.Description: List created virtual device controller's resourceIDs.

VirtualDevicestop.Description: To stop running device controller. It takes valid resourceID as argument.

VirtualDevicedelete.Description: To stop and forget a virtual device controller.

VirtualDevicesdeleteAll.Description: Deletes all the virtual device controllers.

help.Usage:
help or help [command] 
		 Example: help or help VirtualDevicesdeleteAll

set-accountid.Description: Sets the active account for the shell to use.

set-siteid.Description: Sets the site ID for the shell to use.

6lowpanStartPairing.Description: To pair wigwag filament over IP.

bacnetActivityLog.Description: To find the activity of bacnet device.

bacnetGetAllDeviceStates.Description: Get all bacnet device current state.

bacnetSendWhoIs.Description: Send whoIs service request on bacnet line.

set-siteid-as-accountid.Description: set siteID equal to the accountID

createSiteGroup.Usage:
createSiteGroup {group name} {option} {siteID} 
		 Example: createSiteGroup X-group add b555427547128547157415284518745xxxx

createRole.Description: craete a role for particular account

getaRole.Description: Gives details of a particular role

createGroup.Usage:
createGroup {resource group name} 
		 Example: createGroup Kitchen

updateGroup.Usage:
updateGroup {resource group location} {add/remove} {resourceID} 
		 Example: updateGroup Kitchen add VirtualThermostat1125
updateGroup.Description: add or remove the devices from a resource group

getGroup.Description: gives details of the resiurce group

deleteGroup.Usage:
deleteGroup {resource group location} 
		 Example: deleteGroup badroom

modbusStart.Usage:
modbusStart {path of the modbus receipies in json}
		 Example: modbusStart /pathtofile/file.json

modbusGetDeviceMetadata.Description: gives all the device meta data like its state, address and facede etc.

modbusListDevices.Description: list all the devices connected to the Imod6

modbusLogLevel.Description: gives log information of a modbus device

startTunnel.Description: used to login into relay when you are not in local network

postRequests.Usage:
postRequests [selection][command] [type] [property] [argument] [value] 
		 Example: postRequests id=-------- create call null Button

getRelays.Description: List all the relays attached to an account

moveRelayToAccount.Usage:
moveRelayToAccount {relayID} {accountID} {pairing code} 
		 Example: moveRelayToAccount WDRL000003 d55fa29dbad3418883374168ba4791fd AN2XZWQ8R3AS6U7B8XGB6Q8MP
moveRelayToAccount.Description: move a relay to an account

moveRelayToSite.Usage:
moveRelayToSite [relayID] [siteID] [pairing code] 
		 Example: moveRelayToSite WDRL000003 b34c748c4adb4f72b56b213e14161992 AN2XZWQ8R3AS6U7B8XGB6Q8MP

listSiteResources.Description: list all the resources attached to a site

forgetSiteResource.Description: used to delete or unpair a device from the relay

getSiteResourceState.Description: gives the state of a resources

updateSiteResourceState.Usage:
updateSiteResourceState {resourceID} {resource state} {value} 
		 Example: updateSiteResourceState VirtualLightBulb1110 power off
updateSiteResourceState.Description: updates the state of a resource

getResponse.Description: gives responce of given request Id

getSites.Description: it gives a object with all the sites in an account with its info

updateSite.Usage:
updateSite {boolan value (true/false)} {update} 
		 Example: updateSite true hdsvfehjfjbdejwk

deleteSite.Usage:
deleteSite {siteID to be deleted} 
		 Example: deleteSite d3e3hvfkjbe3fi3bfkjb

getSiteinterfaces.Description: list all the interface of deviceJS

getSiteresourcetypes.Description: it list all the respource type to the relay

getAccounts.Description: list all accountID to the cloud

postSchedule.Usage:
postSchedule {object of schedule} 
		 Example: postSchedule {json object}

getaSchedule.Description: return a schedule related to the scheduleID

putSchedule.Usage:
putSchedule {scheduleid} {JSON string for schedule} 
		 Example: putSchedule 0da2dfbad58249e2a15eda4fa22c0712 {json object}

deleteSchedule.Description: Delete a schedule at a site

getUsers.Description: List and iterate through users within an account. An administrator will be able to list all users

executeSiteResourceCommand.Description: Emit events for the device run getSiteResourceState to verify.

getDiagnostics.Description: gives helth info of the relay

VirtualDeviceStopPeriodicEvents.Description: stops all periodic events for virtual devices

VirtualDeviceGeneratePeriodicEvents.Description: start all periodic events for virtual devices

createUserAccessRule.Description: Run to give permission to other account

bacnetListDevices.Description: List bacnet device with its specification

bacnetRelinquishAll.Description: change a interface of bacnet device

bacnetRelinquishDefault.Description: make default settings of a facade

bacnetPriorityArray.Description: return a array of bacnet priority

bacnetStartAll.Description: start all bacnet device connected to the relay

bacnetDeleteRecipes.Description: delete all the receipes of bacnet on relay

bacnetSaveRecipe.Usage:
bacnetSaveRecipe {location of the bacnet receipes} 
		 Example: bacnetSaveRecipe /location_of_receipies.json

getSitedatabase.Description: return all the database of the site

getSitebuckets.Description: return site bucket of the site database

updateSiteResourceName.Description: updates the name of a device

zigbeeGetPanId.Description: returns pan ID of zigbee device

zigbeeGetChannel.Description: return channel of the zigbee device

zigbeeNetworkTopology.Description: return network topology of zigbee devices

zigbeePingDevices.Description: ping all the zigbee device connected to the relay

zigbeeLogLevel.Description: return log level of zigbee device

enoceanLogLevel.Usage:
enoceanLogLevel {log value from 1 to 5} 
		 Example: enoceanLogLevel 2
enoceanLogLevel.Description: return log level of enocean device

debug.Description: Turn debug output on or off

info.Description: gives the info of current account

metrics.Description: Turns on output showing performance of API calls.

programImod6.Usage:
programImod6 {hex file path} 
		 Example: programImod6 /location of hex file.txt

executeBash.Usage:
executeBash {location for relay state} 
		 Example: executeBash '/etc/init.d/devjssupport start'

siteMap.Description: list all the sites with there status and group

getSiteInfo.Description: Returns all info of current site

renameSite.Usage:
renameSite [site name to be given] 
		 Example: renameSite store-XYZ

modbusListResourcesInCloud.Description: List all modbus resources in cloud

bacnetListResourcesInCloud.Description: List all bacnet resources in cloud

zigbeeListResourcesInCloud.Description: List all zigbee resources in cloud

zwaveListResourcesInCloud.Description: List all zwave resources in cloud

enoceanListResourcesInCloud.Description: List all enocean resources in cloud

VirtualDeviceLogLevel.Description: command will generate periodic events for all the registered Virtual Devices

bacnetNativeLogLevel.Description: command will generate periodic events for bacnet device

bacnetStartPortal.Description: restart the bacnet device wnad start portal

getRelayTask.Description: Returns a task with the given task ID

importRelay.Description: Import a relay in account to pair

importRelays.Usage:
importRelays [location of csv file] 
		 Example: importRelays /location of file.csv
importRelays.Description: Import a betch of relay from a .csv file

bindRelayToExistingSite.Description: Bind a relay to an existing site

bindRelayToSite.Description: bind a relay to a new site

subscribeToEvents.Description: Create a websocket to show all the events

getAlerts.Description: Returns all the Alerts to the site

getAnAlert.Usage:
getAnAlert [relayID] [Alert Serial Number] 
		 Example: getAnAlert WWRL000000X fygerfg98437tr43c39g
getAnAlert.Description: Return an alert with the given serila number

dismissAlert.Usage:
dismissAlert [relayID] [Alert Serial Number] 
		 Example: dismissAlert WWRL000000X fygerfg98437tr43c39g

getDeviceLogs.Usage:
getDeviceLogs [relayID] [deviceID] [state] [limit] [sort] 
		 Example: getDeviceLogs WDRL00000P VirtualLightBulb61 state-power 4 desc
getDeviceLogs.Description: to get the logs of a device
